techmeme.title: Ofcom drops an investigation into whether OnlyFans-owner Fenix International is letting under-18s access adult content, but keeps another part of the probe open (Daniel Thomas/Financial Times)
ByteDance researchers demo OmniHuman-1, an AI system that is "easily heads and shoulders above previous deepfake techniques", if ByteDance's clips are accurate (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Apple debuts Invites, an app to help plan events like birthdays, graduations, and more, with Image Playground and Writing Tools tie-ins, for iCloud+ subscribers (Juli Clover/MacRumors)
The Iconfactory launches Tapestry on the App Store, bringing Bluesky, Mastodon, RSS, and more into a single timeline, with a $1.99/month tier to remove ads (Ryan Christoffel/9to5Mac)
Opera launches Opera Air, a free browser focused on mindfulness and mental well-being, including break reminders and ambient soundscapes, for Windows and macOS (Dominic Preston/The Verge)
